alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Furnas; Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 10:29PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Smith, Phillips, southwestern Franklin, southern Furnas and southern Harlan Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1029 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Beaver City to Long Island to Harlan County Dam. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Republican City, Naponee, Harlan County Dam and Woodruff around 1035 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Phillipsburg, Smith Center, Agra, Kirwin, Prairie View, Glade and Athol. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Nebraska.
